available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

getPorts.name: getPorts
getPorts.comment:
Returns names of valid ports on this machine, each of which is likely to be valid to pass as the port argument to open(). The list is regenerated each time this method is called, as port validity is dynamic.

callback: Called with the list of ports.

open.name: open
open.comment: Opens a connection to the given serial port. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.open.port: The name of the serial port to open. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.open.options: Connection options. callback: Called when the connection has been opened.

close.name: close
close.comment:
Closes an open connection. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.close.connectionId: The id of the opened connection. callback: Called when the connection has been closed.

Returns: Returns true if operation was successful.

read.name: read
read.comment: Reads a byte from the given connection. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.read.connectionId: The id of the connection. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.read.bytesToRead: The number of bytes to read. callback: Called when all the requested bytes have been read or when the read blocks.

write.name: write
write.comment: Writes a string to the given connection. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.write.connectionId: The id of the connection. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.write.data: The string to write. callback: Called when the string has been written.

flush.name: flush
flush.comment:
Flushes all bytes in the given connection's input and output buffers. chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.flush.connectionId: The id of the connection. callback: Called when the flush is complete.

Returns: Returns true if operation was successful.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_app.ChromeSerial.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
